title: Normal Distribution: Chatterbox
question_text:
The words per minute spoken by a student at Talk University is approximately normal with a mean of $150$ words per minute and standard deviation of $25$ words per minute.
The shaded area in the figure below represents which of the following probabilities? Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.

choices.text: The probability the number of words spoken by a student at Talk University is between $75$ words per minute and $200$ words per minute.
The probability the number of words spoken by a student at Talk University is between $100$ words per minute and $200$ words per minute.
The probability the number of words spoken by a student at Talk University is between $100$ words per minute and $225$ words per minute.
The probability the number of words spoken by a student at Talk University is between $125$ words per minute and $200$ words per minute.
The probability the number of words spoken by a student at Talk University is between $125$ words per minute and $225$ words per minute.

solution:
The figure shows an area between two standard deviations below the mean and three standard deviations above the mean.

First, figure out the value for two standard deviations below the mean:

$$\mu -2\sigma =150-(2)(25)=100 \ \text{ words per minute}$$

We can eliminate Choices 'A' ,'D', and 'E' because they all state a lower bound of $125$ words per minute.

Next, figure out the value for three standard deviations above the mean:

$$\mu +3\sigma =150+(3)(25)=225 \ \text{ words per minute}$$

Choice 'C' is our answer.
